data.enText: a way of encouraging people by telling them that if you do an activity regularly and try to improve your skill, you will become very good at it
used to say that sth is what you would like to happen or what should happen, but you know it cannot
In an ideal world we would be recycling and reusing everything.
data.chText: 我们要是能回收并再利用所有的东西就再理想不过了。

tr: a tense of verbs used in describing action that has been completed (sometimes regarded as perfective aspect)
being complete of its kind and without defect or blemish

partsOfSpeech.dec: per- 完全,贯穿 + son 声音
per- 完全,贯穿 + form 形状
per- 完全,贯穿 + fume 烟
per- 完全,贯穿 + man 手 + -ent ...的
per- 完全,贯穿 + miss 送出,投掷 + -ion 行为,状态
per- 完全,贯穿 + mit 送,放出
per- 完全,贯穿 + suad 劝告 + -e
per- 完全,贯穿 + suas 劝告 + -ion 行为,状态
per- 完全,贯穿 + severe 严厉的
per- 完全,贯穿 + ceive 抓住,获取
per- 完全,贯穿 + pet 追寻;寻求 + -ual ...的
per- 完全,贯穿 + -ish 像...一样
per- 完全,贯穿 + sist 站立
ef- 出来,从...向外 + fect 做,制作
af- 朝,向,去 + fect 做,制作
de- 离开,向下 + fect 做,制作
in- 在内,进入,使 + fect 做,制作

data.enText: having everything that is necessary; complete and without faults or weaknesses
Well I'm sorry─but nobody's perfect (= used when sb has criticized you) .
data.chText: 呃，对不起。不过，人无完人嘛。
完全正确的；准确的；地道的
精确的副本；绝对合身；天作之合

data.enText: a perfect example of the painter's early style
data.chText: 这位画家早期风格的典范

data.enText: the perfect crime (= one in which the criminal is never discovered)
It was a perfect day for a picnic.
data.chText: 那是野餐最理想的天气。

data.enText: She's the perfect candidate for the job.
data.chText: 她是这项工作的最佳人选。

data.enText: I don't know him─he's a perfect stranger.
data.chText: 我不认识他，他是百分之百的陌生人。

data.enText: connected with the form of a verb that consists of part of the verb have with the past participle of the main verb, used to express actions completed by the present or a particular point in the past or future
‘I have eaten’ is the present perfect tense of the verb ‘to eat’, ‘I had eaten’ is the past perfect and ‘I will have eaten’ is the future perfect.
data.chText: I have eaten是动词eat的现在完成时；I had eaten是过去完成时；I will have eaten是将来完成时。

data.enText: used to say that sth is what you would like to happen or what should happen, but you know it cannot
In an ideal world we would be recycling and reusing everything.
data.chText: 我们要是能回收并再利用所有的东西就再理想不过了。

data.enText: to make sth perfect or as good as you can
As a musician, she has spent years perfecting her technique.
data.chText: 身为音乐家，她多年来不断在技艺上精益求精。

data.enText: the form of a verb that expresses actions completed by the present or a particular point in the past or future, formed in English with part of the verb have and the past participle of the main verb

data.text: excellent ♦ outstanding ♦ perfect ♦ superb ♦ marvellous ♦ exceptional

data.enText: All these words describe sth that is extremely good.
data.chText: 以上各词均形容事物极好。
指优秀的、杰出的、极好的。

data.enText: Excellent is used especially about standards of service or of sth that sb has worked to produce.
data.chText: excellent尤用于服务或人们努力达到的标准：

data.enText: The rooms are excellent value at $20 a night.
data.chText: 这些房间一晚上20元太合算了。

data.enText: Excellent is also used to show that you are very pleased about sth or that you approve of sth.
data.chText: excellent亦用以表示愉快或赞同：
指优秀的、杰出的、出色的。

data.enText: Outstanding is used especially about how well sb does sth or how good sb is at sth.
data.chText: outstanding尤指做某事或在某方面杰出：

data.enText: Perfect is used especially about conditions or how suitable sth is for a purpose.
data.chText: perfect尤指条件状况极好或很合适：
那是散步最理想的环境。

data.enText: She came up with the perfect excuse.
The facilities at the hotel are superb.

data.chText: 指杰出的、优秀的、卓越的。

data.enText: Exceptional is often used about sb's ability or performance.
data.chText: exceptional多用以指人的能力或表现：

data.enText: Exceptional students are given free tuition.
data.chText: 表现优异的学生免交学费。

simple_means.memory_skill: per- 完全,贯穿 + fect 做,制作

ex.enText: The doctor has offered her advice on how to reach an ideal weight.
ex.chText: 医生已经给她提供了如何达到理想体重的建议。

ex.enText: The program offers an ideal opportunity for students to learn about foreign culture.
ex.chText: 该项目为学生提供了了解外国文化的极好机会。

ex.enText: This beach is ideal for a vacation.
ex.chText: 这个海滩是度假的理想去处。

synonyms.bx: 指在所有可能的选择中最好的或最适合的。

ex.enText: That's perfect! This hair style is just what I wanted.
ex.chText: 太完美了！这个发型正是我想要的。

ex.enText: White wine makes a perfect accompaniment to fish.
ex.chText: 白葡萄酒是吃鱼时绝佳的佐餐酒。

synonyms.bx: 强调无可挑剔、完美无缺的。

value.boxr_value: The adjective is pronounced /'pɜːfɪkt/. The verb is pronounced /pə'fekt/. 形容词读作/'pɜːfɪkt/，动词读作/pə'fekt/。

example.ex: Hiring a nanny has turned out to be the perfect solution...
example.tran: 雇用保姆结果成了解决问题的最佳方法。

example.ex: It's a perfect example of a house reflecting the person who lives there...
example.tran: 这是房子反映主人个性的最佳例子。

value.def: Something that is perfect is as good as it could possibly be.

example.ex: Carpet tiles are perfect for kitchens because they're easy to take up and wash...
example.tran: 方块地毯非常适用于厨房，因为其便于揭起来清洗。

example.ex: So this could be the perfect time to buy a home.
example.tran: 所以这可能是买房子的绝佳时机。

value.def: If you say that something is perfect for a particular person, thing, or activity, you are emphasizing that it is very suitable for them or for that activity.

example.ex: Use only clean, Grade A, perfect eggs.
example.tran: 只用表面干净、无磕碰的A级鸡蛋。

value.def: If an object or surface is perfect, it does not have any marks on it, or does not have any lumps, hollows, or cracks in it.
value.tran: 无瑕的；完好的；完美无缺的

example.ex: Some people are always coming up to perfect strangers and asking them what they do...
example.tran: 有些人总爱和完全不认识的人搭讪，询问人家的职业。

example.ex: What he had said to her made perfect sense.
example.tran: 他对她说的话非常合乎情理。

value.def: You can use perfect to give emphasis to the noun following it.

example.ex: We perfected a hand-signal system so that he could keep me informed of hazards...
example.tran: 我们完善了一套手势信号，这样他就能随时告知我什么时候有危险了。

example.ex: I removed the fibroid tumours, using the techniques that I have perfected.
example.tran: 我用完善后的技术摘掉了纤维瘤。

example.ex: ...girls who needed to perfect their English.
example.tran: 需要提高英语水平的女孩们

value.def: If you perfect something, you improve it so that it becomes as good as it can possibly be.

The perfect tenses of a verb are the ones used to talk about things that happened or began before a particular time, as in 'He's already left' and 'They had always liked her'. The present perfect tense is sometimes called the perfect tense.

trans: 使自己精通
